I made the change you suggested, @vkagamlyk. But I also had to make another change as my fix wasn't complete. It did solve the problem that the `Connection` class had an ever increasing list of cancellation registrations, but those registrations weren't disposed and were therefore still stored in the underlying `CancellationTokenSource`.
We've found that by trying out the fix in the service where we initially found the memory leak. The earlier fix here already improved the situation a lot but a memory dump revealed that the `CancellationTokenSource` had a linked list of all cancellation registrations.
The version that is now in this PR doesn't show any increasing memory usage any more. (Confirmed with our service which showed this problems, running for a few hours without any increase in memory usage any more.)

LGTM

> I'm slightly on the fence about this one. It'll be great to have warnings which tells you that you aren't building the GLVs, but I'm not sure if it's necessarily worth adding an entire profile for each of the GLVs for this, given that there is documentation about them, and also we are considering removing the need to use `.glv` in 3.7.0 (as they were initially added due to GLV tests required environment set-up, but we are now using Docker which should be able to remove that need). Would there be an easier way to add the warning in an existing profile?

This was the best method for adding some sort of warning that I could find. It is possible there are better solutions but I don't think it's worth investing much time in. I think this warning would be helpful for current developers, we can remove these profiles once the `.glv` system is torn out.
